availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: S. Grant Jackson (Estill County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Josiah A. Jackson and Elizabeth Martin Jackson. Married to Mary T. Taylor Jackson. Father of Taylor Jackson. Clerk in Estill County in 1860. Enlisted as a private in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) on September 14, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 93.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark, Precinct 4, p. 11.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, p. 56-57.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 180.
Find A Grave, "Lieut Samuel Martin Grant Jackson (June 23, 1838-April 24, 1886)," Memorial #30953513, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30953513 (accessed April 30, 2018).
